description: UK Foreign Secretary David Cameron will criticize other European nations for being “unwilling” to invest in defense as he urges Western democracies to be “tougher and more assertive” in protecting their interests and values.
title: Cameron Takes Aim at Other European Nations on Defense Spending

description: A visa route allowing seasonal workers for Britain’s farms has been extended by five years to 2029, giving agri-businesses time to invest in automation and move away from relying on foreign labor.
title: UK Government Extends Seasonal Worker Visa Program to 2029

description: In mid-April, executives from foreign business chambers descended upon the home of an Indonesian minister to call for the removal of a new imports rule, a sign of the private sector’s increasing consternation over the government’s trade policy.
title: Made-in-Indonesia Rule Threatens Jokowi’s Move Up Value Chain

description: The groundswell of complaints about China’s factory output keeps getting louder, but there’s no sign Beijing is ready for fixes that might backfire on its vulnerable economy.
title: China’s Factory Glut Alarms the World But There’s No Quick Fix

description: Hardline Republican lawmaker Marjorie Taylor Greene moved Wednesday to force a House vote on ousting Speaker Mike Johnson, a fight she is virtually certain to lose but one that will test the GOP leader’s political strength within his party.
title: Republican Greene Forces Vote on Doomed Push to Oust US Speaker

description: President Joe Biden’s decision to hold off supplying about 3,500 bombs to Israel was the culmination of months of rising frustration over Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s conduct of the war in Gaza — and his administration may not be done yet.
title: Biden Widens Rift With Israel in Move That Paused Bomb Shipments

description: Senegal will review fishing deals and licenses signed with its partners that include the European Union to ensure they’re optimized to benefit the sector, newly elected President Bassirou Diomaye Faye said.
title: Senegal’s New President Announces Audit of Fishing Agreements

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is set to hold his first news conference in about two years as he tries to set a new course for his conservative government after suffering a stinging defeat in parliamentary elections last month.
title: South Korea’s President Tries to Reset His Agenda With Rare News Conference

description: Ex-Trump adviser Stephen Miller’s legal group has sued IBM Corp. subsidiary Red Hat Inc. claiming the company’s diversity goals led to the discriminatory treatment and termination of a former White male employee.
title: IBM’s Red Hat Sued by Stephen Miller’s Legal Group for Anti-White Male Bias

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at the aftermath of the House speaker battle. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Johnson Escapes Ouster Threat but Faces Decision on Greene’s Demands

description: North Macedonia’s main nationalist party claimed victory in the Balkan nation’s general election, opening the path for a coalition government that risks hindering already troubled talks on joining the European Union.
title: Nationalists Set to Win North Macedonia Vote in Blow to EU Deal

description: President Joe Biden’s administration will propose a new rule that would allow the US to more quickly expel some undocumented migrants seeking to claim asylum, as the White House grapples with a historic surge of illegal immigration that has strained state and local resources and become a political liability headed into November’s election.
title: Biden to Unveil New Rule Speeding Deportations for Safety Risks

description: Georgia’s Democratic Senator Raphael Warnock dismissed safety concerns from local lawmakers about additional flights to Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport in an interview with Bloomberg Television on Wednesday.
title: Senator Warnock Dismisses Safety Concerns Over Adding More Flights to Washington

description: A political action committee backing Donald Trump is opening an account on TikTok, the popular social-media app facing pressure from the US government over privacy and national security concerns.
title: Trump Super PAC Joins TikTok in 2024 Push for Younger Voters

description: The cost of extending the 2017 tax cuts enacted under President Donald Trump has expanded to $3.8 trillion over ten years, putting a massive price tag on what is likely to be a top issue in Washington next year, according to new estimates from Congress’s fiscal scorekeeper.
title: Trump Tax Cut Extension Cost Swells to $3.8 Trillion, CBO Warns

description: US lawmakers grilled public school leaders over their handling of antisemitism, the latest in a series of hearings on the matter that have already led to the resignation of two college presidents.
title: Public School Leaders Across US Are Grilled by Congress on Antisemitism

description: As Israel’s war on Hamas in Gaza has grown increasingly controversial, arms suppliers including Italy, Spain and Canada have all halted sales. Yet that mattered little while the US persisted with shipments.
title: US Arms Delay to Israel Brings Anxiety and Talk of Self-Reliance

description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams is getting a new Democratic challenger in next year’s election: Zellnor Myrie, a left-leaning state senator from Brooklyn.
title: NYC Mayor Gets New Challenger for 2025 in Brooklyn Progressive

description: Finnish lawmakers passed measures that limit political strikes as well as work stoppages supporting such action that has hampered the Nordic economy in the past months.
title: Finland Bans Political Strikes Longer Than 24 Hours in New Law

description: Ghanaian Supreme Court judges started hearing two separate lawsuits challenging the constitutionality of a bill that seeks to punish people identifying as LGBTQ with up to three years in prison.
title: Ghana Supreme Court Starts Hearing Challenges to Anti-LGBTQ Bill

description: European Union member states have tentatively approved a plan to use the profits generated by Russian sovereign assets frozen in the bloc to support Ukraine’s recovery and military defense.
title: EU Backs Plan to Tap Profits From Russian Assets to Aid Ukraine

description: Scotland’s new First Minister John Swinney appointed a political rival and past leadership candidate Kate Forbes as his deputy, in an attempt to unite his divided Scottish National Party ahead of a UK-wide election this year.
title: Scotland’s Swinney Gives Rival Key Role in Bid for Party Unity

description: The UK is expelling a top Russian diplomat, Home Secretary James Cleverly told Parliament, as part of a crackdown on what he said was Moscow’s intelligence-gathering in Britain.
title: UK to Expel Russian Diplomat in Crackdown on Alleged Spying

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Treasure Hunters: Why Finders Doesn't Mean Keepers

description: Norway’s planned changes to a so-called exit tax threaten to trigger a wave of departures by startup founders and companies, according to a lobby group.
title: Norway Risks Outflow of Startups Dismayed by Harsher Exit Tax

description: For Russia’s elite, passing on family wealth has become more complex than ever.
title: Rich Russians Stuck in Limbo as War Creates Succession Conundrum

description: Rishi Sunak suffered a fresh blow after one of his Conservative Members of Parliament defected to the Labour Party just days after a catastrophic set of local elections for the governing Tories.
title: Sunak Suffers Fresh Blow as Conservative MP Defects to Labour

description: Welcome to the Year of the Elections, Bloomberg’s newsletter on the votes that matter to markets, business, and policy amid the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades.
title: The Fear of War With Russia Looms Over Lithuanian Vote

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: Modi Eyes India’s Newest State as Gateway to South for Historic Win

description: Croatia’s prime minister was on course to steer the Adriatic nation to the political right as he agreed to form a coalition with an anti-immigration nationalist party three weeks after suffering an electoral setback.
title: Croatia’s Premier Takes Country Rightward With Nationalist Pact

description: Last week, a top Chinese diplomat took to the microphones at the United Nations to harangue the US for blocking a resolution that would have backed Palestinians’ bid for membership, saying it had “shattered the decades long dream of the Palestinian people.”
title: Gaza Is China’s New Wedge Issue to Split US From Global South

description: Turkey is working on a plan to set different natural gas and electricity tariffs for different income groups, according to a senior official with knowledge of the matter.
title: Turkey Mulls Higher Energy Bills For Higher-Income Households

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Crime-Weary South Africans May Punish ANC in Election

description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa accused the main opposition party of treason after it flighted an election advertisement that shows the national flag being burnt.
title: Ramaphosa Labels Opposition Flag-Burning Election Ad Treasonous

description: President Joe Biden chided Donald Trump during a visit to swing-state Wisconsin, championing a major Microsoft Corp. investment at the same site his 2024 rival’s plans for a flagship technology project by Foxconn fizzled.
title: Biden Jabs Trump on Foxconn With Microsoft Project at Same Site

description: Taiwan’s exports to the US surged by a record last month while shipments to China fell, underscoring the accelerating decoupling of technology supply chains between the world’s two largest economies.
title: Taiwan Exports to US Jump by Record as China Shipments Fall

description: Ukrainian authorities suspect businessman Igor Kolomoisky of organizing an attempted contract killing more than two decades ago, according to media reports, adding a new layer of potential criminal liability to the jailed tycoon who once backed Volodymyr Zelenskiy.
title: Tycoon Kolomoisky Accused of Ordering Hit, Ukrainska Pravda Says

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi suggested the main opposition party received illegal cash from billionaires Mukesh Ambani and Gautam Adani to fund its election campaign, a surprising allegation that comes in the middle of a heated voting battle.
title: Modi Alleges Ambani, Adani Giving Opposition Party Illegal Cash

description: Thailand’s biggest business lobby urged the central bank to cut interest rate and work with the government on ways to revive business and consumption activity, after slashing its own estimate for economic growth.
title: Thai Business Lobby Joins Rate Cut Call as It Trims GDP Forecast

description: Iran has just weeks to comply with monitoring demands issued by the United Nations’ nuclear watchdog, or risk being slapped with a new round of diplomatic censure.
title: UN Nuclear Watchdog Puts Iran on Notice Ahead of Key Report

description: A Hong Kong court allowed the government to ban a popular protest song when used with criminal intent, dealing a setback to free speech in the city.
title: Hong Kong Court Approves Government Ban of Protest Song

description: German bankers plan to sign an open letter against xenophobia in a move initiated by the Bundesbank and lobby group Frankfurt Main Finance ahead of next month’s European Parliament elections.
title: German Banks, Nagel Make Call Against Xenophobia Before EU Vote

description: German authorities are investigating after a Berlin state minister and former mayor was attacked by an unknown assailant, the latest evidence of an upsurge in political violence ahead of next month’s European Parliament elections.
title: German Authorities on Alert After Latest Attack on Politician

description: The Federal Reserve has demonstrated that it is relying on data to make interest-rate decisions.
title: No, Jerome Powell Isn’t Playing Politics

description: Thailand’s new health minister said he plans to review the country’s cannabis policy, signaling a possible u-turn that could make marijuana a narcotic again after it became the first country in Asia to decriminalize the plant.
title: Thailand’s New Health Minister Signals Rethink of Cannabis Decriminalization Policy

description: The US paused a shipment of bombs to Israel over worries about Israel nearing a decision to launch a wide-ranging military offensive on the southern Gaza city of Rafah, which President Joe Biden opposes, according to a senior administration official.
title: US Paused Weapons Shipment to Israel Over Rafah Invasion Concern

description: The World Bank faces a funding dilemma if Accra chooses to go ahead with the punitive law that tramples all over the lender’s anti-discrimination standards.
title: Ghana’s Fight Over Anti-LGBTQ Law Threatens $20 Billion Debt Deal

description: Increasing insecurity and corruption are key concerns in the runup to May 29 elections that are expected to force the African National Congress into a power-sharing arrangement.
title: Crime and Its $40 Billion Hit to the Economy Are at the Heart of South Africa’s Vote

description: UK Chancellor Jeremy Hunt would have an extra £10 billion a year for tax cuts if the Bank of England stopped selling the bonds it bought over more than a decade under quantitative easing, according to BOE disclosures.
title: Hunt May Net £10 Billion for Tax Cut if BOE Shifts on Asset Sales

description: Elon Musk has made no secret of his interest in the far-right Alternative for Germany. After a series of self-inflicted set-backs, it’s less clear that the party can retain the enthusiasm of its voters.
title: Musk Is Engaging With Europe’s Far Right But Voters Aren’t So Sure

description: Spain may be about to become the first of the euro zone’s four biggest economies to name a woman to lead its central bank.
title: Spain’s Central Bank May Be Led by a Woman for the First Time

description: Ukraine’s capital of Kyiv as well as the western city of Lviv near the border with Poland were under missile attack early Wednesday, local authorities said on Telegram.
title: Ukraine’s Kyiv, Lviv Under Attack After More Than 1 Month Pause

description: Colombia’s Ecopetrol SA is seeking a waiver from the US to import natural gas from Venezuela as the South American country faces a supply shortfall of the power-station fuel from next year.
title: Ecopetrol Seeks Waiver for Venezuelan Gas to Plug Shortfall

description: Kim Ki Nam, a propaganda mastermind who helped forge the cult of personality for the family dynasty that has ruled North Korea since its founding in the Cold War, has died at the age of 94.
title: North Korea Propaganda Boss Who Shaped Image of Leaders Dies at 94

description: Colombian President Gustavo Petro said the nation’s institutions suffer from “structural corruption” as he tried to distance himself from a recent bribery scandal involving allies.
title: Petro Seeks to Distance Himself From Colombian Graft Scandal
